sentences.english: The most famous comet in history is called Halley's comet.
sentences.chinese: 历史上最著名的彗星叫作哈雷彗星。

sentences.english: The most famous comet in history is called Halley's comet.
sentences.chinese: 历史上最著名的彗星叫作哈雷彗星。

sentences.english: The cometary ejection play a crucial role in formation and evolution of the meteoroid stream.
sentences.chinese: 彗星的喷发速度在流星群的演化过程中起着重要作用。

sentences.english: Moonlight holly, the Soppho Comet, Angel's tears below a tree.
sentences.chinese: 月光冬青，莎孚彗星，天使的眼泪垂落树下。
彗星样的行星会消失吗？

sentences.english: Comet assay detects DNA single-strand breaks of single cell.
sentences.chinese: 彗星试验研究和测定的是单个细胞DNA链断裂。

sentences.english: A newly-discovered comet is plunging toward the sun and probably will not survive.
sentences.chinese: 一个新发现的彗星正在冲向太阳而且极可能不会幸存。

sentences.english: I can hardly wait to see the new comet.
sentences.chinese: 我急不可待地要见到新彗星的出现。

sentences.english: brushed past the hidden nucleus of Halley's comet in 1986.
sentences.chinese: 在1986年与哈雷彗星擦肩而过并拍下了其核心。

sentences.english: A comet is at aphelion when it is farthest from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 彗星离太阳最远时就是在它的远日点上。

sentences.english: This has been an active year for big, bright sungrazers.
sentences.chinese: 今年是明亮的掠日彗星的活跃年。

sentences.english: Loose collections of these ices and small rocky particles form into comets.
sentences.chinese: 这些冰和小岩体松散地组合形成彗星。

sentences.english: Meteorites carrying the chemicals might have crash-landed on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 携带有化学物质的彗星可能会撞到我们的地球上。

sentences.english: A comet is an icy body that releases gas or dust.
sentences.chinese: 彗星是一个释放着气体和尘埃的冰质天体。

sentences.english: Some of these comets would have slammed into Earth, causing catastrophic results to life.
sentences.chinese: 其中一些彗星会冲向地球，给生物带来灾难性的后果。

sentences.english: I told my sis to ask Oppa about how far between his house and Hyesungie's.
sentences.chinese: 我叫我的姐姐问他和彗星的房子离得有多远。

definition: asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter
